intro: Halothamnus, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are typically found in arid and coastal environments, thriving in saline and sandy soils. They are characterized by their succulent leaves and showy, often violet or blue, flowers that bloom in summer. Halothamnus species are well-adapted to harsh conditions, with thick cuticles and specialized structures to store water. Their ecological importance includes stabilizing dunes and providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
